DataElement.preferredName: Patient Histological Confirmation Metastatic Solid Neoplasm Progressive Disease Standard Therapy Or No Standard Therapy Exist Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded indicator to determine eligibility for clinical trial participation for questions related to confirmation of metastatic solid neoplasm that is increasing in scope or severity after standard of care treatment for the disease, or for which no standard of care treatment for the disease exists as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Histological Procedure Confirmation Metastatic Solid Neoplasm Progressive Disease Standard Treatment Or Negation Standard Treatment Be Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Technique or procedure used for the study of the microanatomy of tissues and their cellular structure; usually involves microscopic examination of tissue slices._Having been established or verified._A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site._A benign or malignant neoplasm arising from tissues that do not include fluid areas.  Representative examples include epithelial neoplasms (e.g. lung carcinoma, prostate carcinoma, breast carcinoma, colon carcinoma), and neoplasms arising from the soft tissues and bones (e.g. leiomyosarcoma, liposarcoma, chondrosarcoma, osteosarcoma).  Neoplasms originating from the blood or bone marrow (leukemias and myeloproliferative disorders) are not considered solid tumors._A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity._A therapy approved by a health regulatory authority and in wide use, which is considered to be the standard of care for the management of a specific disease or condition._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._A therapy approved by a health regulatory authority and in wide use, which is considered to be the standard of care for the management of a specific disease or condition._The state or fact of existing at a place and time._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Histological Procedure Confirmation Metastatic Solid Neoplasm Progressive Disease Standard Treatment Or Negation Standard Treatment Be Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Technique or procedure used for the study of the microanatomy of tissues and their cellular structure; usually involves microscopic examination of tissue slices.:Having been established or verified.:A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.:A benign or malignant neoplasm arising from tissues that do not include fluid areas.  Representative examples include epithelial neoplasms (e.g. lung carcinoma, prostate carcinoma, breast carcinoma, colon carcinoma), and neoplasms arising from the soft tissues and bones (e.g. leiomyosarcoma, liposarcoma, chondrosarcoma, osteosarcoma).  Neoplasms originating from the blood or bone marrow (leukemias and myeloproliferative disorders) are not considered solid tumors.:A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity.:A therapy approved by a health regulatory authority and in wide use, which is considered to be the standard of care for the management of a specific disease or condition.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:A therapy approved by a health regulatory authority and in wide use, which is considered to be the standard of care for the management of a specific disease or condition.:The state or fact of existing at a place and time.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Technique or procedure used for the study of the microanatomy of tissues and their cellular structure; usually involves microscopic examination of tissue slices.
Having been established or verified.
A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.

A benign or malignant neoplasm arising from tissues that do not include fluid areas.  Representative examples include epithelial neoplasms (e.g. lung carcinoma, prostate carcinoma, breast carcinoma, colon carcinoma), and neoplasms arising from the soft tissues and bones (e.g. leiomyosarcoma, liposarcoma, chondrosarcoma, osteosarcoma).  Neoplasms originating from the blood or bone marrow (leukemias and myeloproliferative disorders) are not considered solid tumors.
A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.
A therapy approved by a health regulatory authority and in wide use, which is considered to be the standard of care for the management of a specific disease or condition.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A therapy approved by a health regulatory authority and in wide use, which is considered to be the standard of care for the management of a specific disease or condition.
The state or fact of existing at a place and time.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient is registered to t
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is registered to the Phase 1 portion of study, does patient have a histologically confirmed metastatic or locally advanced unresectable solid tumor that has progressed on or after available standard of care therapy or for which no acceptable standard of care therapy exists, or in which the patient declines standard of care therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed solid tumor malignancy that is metastatic or recurrent and for which standard curative or palliative measures do not exist or are no longer effective?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed rare solid tumors, as listed in Appendix D, that has progressed on standard therapy or for which there is no longer standard of care therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed rare solid tumors that has progressed on standard therapy or for which there is no longer standard of care therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Dose Escalation: Does patient have histologically confirmed cancer that is metastatic or unresectable and has progressed on standard therapies which would have included 5-FU or capecitabine?
